relation: For a meaning of poiesis: 4 notes/interfaces
POIESIS, p0es1s, p0es1e – and beyond: A retroperspective
POIESIS, p0es1s, p0es1e – e adiante: Uma retroperspectiva
Para uma razao da poiesis: 4 notas/interfaces
p0es1s: Ästhetik digitaler Poesie/The Aesthetics of Digital Poetry
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {4858=Site is getting routinely updated and will be unavailable 01.08.2015 08:00 to 09:00 UTC., 879=Friedrich W. Block is the Director of the Brückner-Kühner-Foundation and the Kunsttempel Gallery in Kassel, Germany. He is the curator of numerous exhibitions, literary and academic events, and he has also worked as an artist. Since 1992 he has been responsable for the 'p0es1s' project on digital poetry and since 2000 for the 'Kasseler Komik-Kolloquium'. His research concentrates on contemporary literature, language art, media poetics and humor. Block is co-editor of the 'Kulturen des Komischen' series. Among others he wrote IO. poesis digitalis. }
textBeforeTable: Works by this author Friedrich W. Block is the Director of the Brückner-Kühner-Foundation and the Kunsttempel Gallery in Kassel, Germany. He is the curator of numerous exhibitions, literary and academic events, and he has also worked as an artist. Since 1992 he has been responsable for the 'p0es1s' project on digital poetry and since 2000 for the 'Kasseler Komik-Kolloquium'. His research concentrates on contemporary literature, language art, media poetics and humor. Block is co-editor of the 'Kulturen des Komischen' series. Among others he wrote IO. poesis digitalis.  Short biography:  Revisions required Record Status:  Male Gender:  Germany Nationality:  Germany Kassel Residency:  Friedrich W. Block
